Description: Fragment from the shoulder of an Attic pottery black-figured neck-amphora. Tongues alternately black and purple above. Woman and satyr gesticulating to right; part of a draped figure at break to tight.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College Dublin, Department of Classics, Classical Museum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Transferred from the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford (AN1896-1908-G.137.6)
A piece from the circle of Group E; Vickers notes its close to the Painter of the Vatican Mourner.
Bibliographic references: CVA UCD & UCC / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Ireland, Fascicule 1: University College Dublin, University College Cork (p. 18, no. 3, pl. 14, no. 3)
Vickers 1971 / Some Unpublished Sherds from Naukratis in Dublin (p. 117, no. 14, pl. 14.N)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0863)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: AN1896-1908-G.137.6 (Old Ashmolean Museum accession number)
